title: Commending Reverend Dr. Audley Donaldson upon the occasion of being named Rector of St. Stephen and St. Martin Church in Brooklyn, New York
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE RESOLUTION commending Reverend Dr. Audley Donaldson upon the
occasion  of  being named Rector of St. Stephen and St. Martin Church in
Brooklyn, New York

WHEREAS, The character and richness of religious and community  life  in
this  noble Empire State is nourished and fulfilled through the faithful
concern and selfless devotion of those who would commit  their  energies
and purpose to the ministry of others; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to bring full recog-
nition  and just tribute to those individuals who distinguish themselves
and the ministry through their unremitting commitment and preeminence of
service; and
  WHEREAS, This Legislative Body is justly proud to commend Reverend Dr.
Audley Donaldson upon the occasion of being named Rector of St.  Stephen
and  St.  Martin  Church,  to be celebrated at an Appreciation Dinner on
Saturday, January 15, 2011, at the Church of the Redeemer; and
  WHEREAS, Prior to this, Father Donaldson was Priest in Charge  of  St.
Stephen  and  St.  Martin  Church  and  the Church of the Redeemer, both
located in Brooklyn, New York; and
  WHEREAS, Audley Donaldson is an  ordained  Episcopal  Priest;  he  was
accepted  at  the  United  Theological College of the West Indies and in
September 1976, he started his theological training; and
  WHEREAS, In 1980, he received a Bachelor's degree  with  second  class
honors  from  the  University of the West Indies and was ordained to the
Priesthood in July of 1981; four years later  he  completed  a  one-year
residency in Clinical Pastoral Education and a Master of Scared Theology
from Yale University; and
  WHEREAS, IN 1992, Father Audley Donaldson completed a Doctor of Minis-
try  at New York Theological Seminary and in 1997, was named a fellow of
the prestigious Institute for Educational Leadership; and
  WHEREAS, Reverend Dr. Audley Donaldson accepted a position with Family
Resource Coalition of America in Chicago, Illinois; as its  Director  of
Constituency Building, he was largely responsible for designing a series
of  national  conferences and symposiums with diverse communities in the
United States; and
  WHEREAS, Dr. Audley Donaldson also  served  as  Adjunct  Professor  of
Psychology at Gateway Community College in New Haven, Connecticut; and
  WHEREAS, Father Audley Donaldson is a certified Diversity Trainer with
the  State of Connecticut; he designed a curriculum on diversity  train-
ing for children, and for the past 10 years, he has been  working  as  a
diversity  trainer  with  elementary,  middle  and high school students,
along with their teachers and parents in Connecticut; and
  WHEREAS, Most recently Father Audley Donaldson served as Principal  of
St.  Mark's  Day  School  and  Associate  Priest at St. Mark's Episcopal
Church, Brooklyn, New York; and
  WHEREAS, Father Audley Donaldson's commitment to social gospel and the
unique understanding he has of ministry has taken him to countries  such
as  South  Africa,  Zambia  and Ethiopia where he continues to work with
orphanages and agencies supporting disadvantaged children; and
  WHEREAS, Father Audley Donaldson has brought to his ministry an  over-
whelming  spirit  of  charity  and  compassion,  acting  from vision and
enlightenment in conducting his  administrative  and  spiritual  duties,
while  always  displaying  the highest standards of personal and profes-
sional integrity and dedication; and
  WHEREAS, This distinguished man of God has always given enlightenment,
guidance and wisdom to the many entrusted to his care and  has  adminis-

tered abundantly and unstintingly to the spiritual and corporal needs of
all; and
  WHEREAS,  It  is the sense of this Legislative Body that when a person
of such noble aims and accomplishments is brought to our attention it is
appropriate to publicly and jubilantly proclaim and commend  that  indi-
vidual for the edification of others; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
commend Reverend Dr. Audley Donaldson upon the occasion of  being  named
Rector  of  St.  Stephen  and  St.  Martin Church in Brooklyn, New York,
noting his unremitting and compassionate faith and his exemplary service
to God, man, and his community, and extending to him the heartfelt  best
wishes  of  this Legislative Body for a future of purposeful success and
wellbeing; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Reverend Dr. Audley Donaldson, Brooklyn, New York.
